summary: The Muhammad Ali American Boxing Revival Act amends the Professional Boxing Safety Act of 1996 to establish new requirements for unified boxing organizations and to enhance the well-being of professional boxers. It mandates stricter medical examinations, including MRI and pregnancy tests, for boxers. The bill also details anti-doping programs, boxing conduct policies, conflict of interest prohibitions, and requirements for boxing commissions. It requires minimum payments to boxers and addresses issues of payment, insurance, and the handling of positive test results. The legislation aims to increase boxer safety, choice, and provide industry standards.
